Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw basic shapes to represent two different habitats but may not distinguish clearly between land and water habitats.
The student might include a few simple figures or symbols to represent living things but without clear differentiation between plants and animals.
CANNOT: The student is likely unable to consistently differentiate between a land habitat and a water habitat in the drawings (e.g., may draw water creatures like fish in the land habitat).
The student may not include a range of plants in the land habitat and may show items inconsistent with habitat (e.g., fish swimming in trees).
The student may not be able to accurately differentiate or label plants versus animals in the water habitat.
The student likely does not show patterns in plant and animal diversity or confuse habitats for certain species (e.g., drawing a squirrel in the water habitat).
The student does not use drawings to effectively compare the different types of living things between the two habitats.
